intro: Alsophila andohahelensis, commonly known as the Andohahela tree fern, is a species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in humid forests. Its rhizome is thick and fibrous, supporting its upright growth habit. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
